column1: Smoque BBQ////The baby back ribs rivaled ribs I've had anywhere else
column2: but the real star for me were the St. Louis ribs.  They were meatier and juicier than their baby back equivalents and with extra barbeque sauce they were to die for.  The brisket was excellent as well
column3: fall apart tender with great smoke and beef flavor.  I was also a big fan of the vinegary sauce that came along with the brisket.  As for the sides
column4: I enjoyed the mac and cheese which was cheesy
column5: creamy and everything a good mac and cheese should be.  However
column6: the side I enjoyed the most was the peach cobbler.
